thread.title: PLDT, Army trip Shakey’s rivals
thread.title_full: PLDT, Army trip Shakey’s rivals | mb.com.ph | Philippine News

author: Kristel Satumbaga
title: PLDT, Army trip Shakey’s rivals
text:
by Kristel Satumbaga
October 12, 2015 Games Saturday
(The Arena, San Juan)
12:45 p.m. – Coast Guard vs Navy (V-League)
3 p.m. – Cignal vs Air Force (Spikers’ Turf)
5 p.m. – Sta Elena vs PLDT (Spikers’ Turf)
PLDT’s Janine Marciano scores off Coast Guard’s Hyrize Macabuhay during their Shakey’s V-League match yesterday at The Arena in San Juan. The Ultrafast Spikers won in straight sets. (Bob Dungo Jr.)
PLDT Home Ultera bucked the absence of top star Alyssa Valdez and thrashed Coast Guard, 25-10, 25-11, 25-20, yesterday to open its bid for a second crown in the Shakey’s V-League Season 12 Reinforced Conference at The Arena in San Juan.
Former San Beda standout Janine Marciano fired 13 points including three service aces while veteran Lou-Ann Latigay added 12 markers as the Ultrafast Spikers made short work of the Lady Dolphins.
The Ultrafast Spikers won despite missing the services of Valdez, who is concentrating on her stint with the Ateneo Lady Eagles in the ongoing UAAP women’s beach volleyball tournament.
Also missing for the team coached by Roger Gorayeb is San Sebastian star Gretchel Soltones, who is also listed in the official roster.
PLDT is aiming to end the year by winning its second crown after beating Army in three games last May to rule the Open Conference.
Army, likewise, made its title campaign felt after giving newcomer Kia Forte a rude welcome with a 25-15, 25-18, 25-11 victory in the second game.
Former Most Valuable Players Jovelyn Gonzaga and Nene Bautista led the Lady Troopers with 12 and 10 points, respectively.
Behind Marciano and Latigay, the Ultrafast Spikers took the first two sets with relative ease but had to dig deep in the third to deny the Lady Dolphins a chance to extend the game.
Rossan Fajardo scored 10 points for Coast Guard in a losing effort.
